intro: Mariscus borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palm-like leaves and small, delicate flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
